title: How does the proportion spent on home care vary within each client group budget?
analysis_commentary:
Overall, older people (65 and over) have the highest proportion spent on home care, around 23% between 1996-97 and 2010-11; since then it has decreased to 21% in 2012-13. For adults under 65 with a physical disability or sensory impairment, the proportion spent on home care initially increased to a high of 23% in 2001-02, since then it decreased to 19% in 2012-13.

For adults under 65 with learning disabilities, the proportion has been continuously increasing, from 2% in 1994-95 to a high of 14% in 2010-11. Since then it has decreased slightly to 13% in 2012-13. Adults under 65 with mental health needs have the lowest proportion spent on home care overall with around 5-6%, however, this increased slightly to 7% in 2012-13.
data_source: Health & social care information centre, Personal Social Services Expenditure and Unit Costs
